channel.title: On a Mission
channel.description: A journey to the stars doesn’t just begin at the launchpad. Discover new worlds through epic stories told by scientists on missions to outer space.
channel.itunes:subtitle: On a Mission audio podcast episodes
channel.itunes:summary: A journey to the stars doesn’t just begin at the launchpad. Discover new worlds through epic stories told by scientists on missions to outer space.
channel.itunes:keywords: Jet Propulsion Laboratory, NASA JPL, Insight Mars, Mars missions, Mars lander, Mars exploration, mars, NASA missions
channel.itunes:author: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

item.title: Before You Can Drive, First You Have to Fly – S4E9
item.description: Before a rover can make tracks on Mars, it first has to rocket off Earth, speed through space, and then alight gently on the planet’s surface. Al Chen and Swati Mohan guide us through the many stages of a rover’s flight to Mars.

item.title: How to Drive a Mars Rover – S4E8
item.description: Buckle up for a Mars tour with rover driver Vandi Verma, and learn how NASA’s rovers have evolved to better explore this alien world.

item.title: Flying with Ingenuity: the Mars Helicopter – S4E7
item.description: Bob Balaram and Teddy Tzanetos share stories of how the Mars helicopter came to be, and transport us on Ingenuity’s flights through dusty Martian skies.

item.title: The Promise of Perseverance – S4E6
item.description: The Perseverance rover holds many promises: to look for evidence of life on Mars, to collect rock samples meant to be sent to Earth one day, and to test technology that could be used in a future human Mars mission.

item.title: A Ton of Curiosity - S4E5
item.description: The Curiosity rover is a big nerd at heart, fitted with a science lab to take in the planet Mars. Get the inside scoop on the mission’s many discoveries and dramas after a decade on the Red Planet.

item.title: A Lifetime on Mars: The Adventures of Spirit and Opportunity - S4E4
item.description: Born together, the Spirit and Opportunity twin rovers followed divergent paths after they landed on opposite sides of Mars. Opportunity’s journey was marked by good fortune, while Spirit’s was troubled from the start.

item.title: Rise of the Twins: Spirit and Opportunity - S4E3
item.description: After two failed missions to Mars, NASA tried to double its odds for success by sending twin rovers to the Red Planet. Part one of the story of Spirit and Opportunity takes us from their birth to their launch from Earth.

item.title: First Steps: Sojourner - S4E2
item.description: NASA’s first rover on Mars was a cute little bundle of robotic joy. Many thought it was likely to fail. Instead, Sojourner revolutionized how we explore Mars, and marked the start of 25 years of Mars rover adventures.

item.title: Driven to Mars - S4E1
item.description: Episode one launches with Jennifer Trosper in the driver’s seat. As she looks in the rearview mirror at twenty-five years of exploring with NASA’s Mars rovers, she reveals how their progression has kept pace with milestones in her life.

item.title: Season 4 Preview: Mars Rovers
item.description: In the fourth season of “On a Mission” we’ll be transported to the Red Planet with all five of NASA’s Mars rovers.

item.title: Season 3, Episode 10: A Voyager’s View of Earth
item.description: The Voyager 1 spacecraft has traveled farther away from Earth than any human-made object. Candy Hansen and David Grinspoon talk about the Voyager mission, and its humbling perspective of our planet as a tiny blue dot in the blackness of space.

item.title: Season 3, Episode 9: Life Bound
item.description: We hike in the Australian Outback with Abigail Allwood to visit the most ancient fossils on Earth, and track the imprint of life over space and time with David Grinspoon.

item.title: Season 3, Episode 8: Fueled by Fire
item.description: From fires in outer space to raging wildfires on Earth, fire experts Gary Ruff and Natasha Stavros reveal how fingers of flame reach out around our world.

item.title: Season 3, Episode 7: Storm Warning
item.description: Get swept away as we fly into massive hurricanes, and hear how the rumblings of climate change will cause clouds to gather into ever more powerful storms.

item.title: Season 3, Episode 6: Air and Shield
item.description: As we fly around with NASA pilots, we’ll explore Earth’s air space with scientists Annmarie Eldering and Armin Sorooshian -- from wispy clouds high above, to tiny particles that make up air pollution.

item.title: Season 3, Episode 5: Frozen in Time
item.description: Bundle up! We’ll be diving into ice-covered waters with an upside-down robot, and exploring Greenland’s massive ice sheet with oceanographer Josh Willis.

item.title: Season 3, Episode 4: A World Shaped by Water
item.description: Dive to the deepest point of the ocean with an astronaut, brave the high seas with an oceanographer, and meander through sparkling rivers with a hydrologist.

item.title: Season Three, Episode 3: On the Surface
item.description: Like waves of the ocean, our planet’s surface is in constant motion. In this episode, we’ll travel to tropical rainforests to dig into soils with an ecologist, and fly drones with an earthquake expert to spot shifts in the ground beneath our feet.

item.title: Season Three, Episode 2: Genesis
item.description: Have you ever wanted to see the awesome spectacle of an erupting volcano? There’s no better guide for such an adventure than JPL volcanologist Rosaly Lopes.

item.title: Season Three, Episode 1: An Astronaut’s View of Earth
item.description: You might think you know Earth, but astronaut’s views from outer space help us see our world in a whole new light.

item.title: Season Three, Episode 0: To the Ends of the Earth
item.description: In season 3, we’ll travel to the ends of the Earth with scientists who explore different aspects of our unique planet.

item.title: Season Two, Episode 10: Comets: A Love Story
item.description: Eugene and Carolyn Shoemaker’s love of exploration changed our understanding of the cosmos.

item.title: Season Two, Episode 9: Hunting in the Dark for Monsters
item.description: Finding black rocks in the darkness of space isn’t easy, but new methods could help spot them all.

item.title: Season Two, Episode 8: Diamonds in the Ice
item.description: Every year, intrepid Antarctica explorers hunt for space rocks that have fallen to Earth.

item.title: Season Two, Episode 7: Planet Asteroid
item.description: What’s in a name? Whether you call it a planet or an asteroid, missions that explore small worlds are always exciting.

item.title: Season Two, Episode 6: The Prospects of Heavy Metal
item.description: Asteroids, ho! Pioneering space miners dream of Psyche, the largest metal asteroid in the solar system.

item.title: Season Two, Episode 5: Catch a Falling Star
item.description: Why are missions like OSIRIS-REx bringing pieces of an asteroid back home?

item.title: Season Two, Episode 4: Deflecting Disaster
item.description: Unlike the dinosaurs, we have a space program. There are many ways we could steer an asteroid off its path towards Earth.

item.title: Season Two, Episode 3: Bracing for a Crash
item.description: If a big asteroid is heading our way, how does NASA prepare for the oncoming disaster?

item.title: Season Two, Episode 2: Impact!
item.description: What happens when a giant asteroid hits Earth?

item.title: Season Two, Episode 1 - The Sky Is Falling
item.description: Earth is in a cosmic shooting gallery. With so many asteroids zipping around, how can we find them all before they find us?

item.title: Season Two, Episode 0 - Asteroids!
item.description: The upcoming season will feature stories of asteroid exploration.

item.title: Bonus episode: InSight’s Insights
item.description: What's happened with InSight since it landed on Mars?

item.title: Arrival
item.description: InSight is lining up to land on Mars. The trip from the top of the atmosphere to the surface of Mars is 6-and-a-half minutes of sheer terror.

item.title: We Are the World
item.description: Missions to outer space have come a long way since the days of Cold War competition. Farah Alibay finds that building relationships is a big part of building spacecraft.

item.title: Worlds of Wonder
item.description: Technology can take you to unexpected places. The MarCO cubesats, flying towards Mars with InSight, are breaking new ground on how far these small satellites can go.

item.title: Robots Lend a Hand
item.description: Ashitey Trebi-Ollennu is in charge of the InSight mission’s robotic arm and hand. His work on space robots has led him to give a helping hand back home.

item.title: A Matter of Life and Death
item.description: Earth is a living, dynamic world thanks to volcanoes and the planetary heat that fuels them. The InSight mission wants to see if Mars also has a heartbeat deep inside its cold exterior.

item.title: True Grit on the Road to Mars
item.description: Space missions often defy the odds, overcoming all obstacles. The people who work on these missions also face challenges to get where they are today. Marleen Martinez Sundgaard, the testbed lead for InSight, personifies this tenacious spirit.

item.title: Music of the Spheres
item.description: The Earth "rings" when earthquakes strike, just as vibrations through a bell create a ringing sound. The InSight mission will see if tremors cause Mars to chime with its own planetary song.

item.title: The Danger of Going to Mars
item.description: Many spacecraft have died trying to get to Mars. The current record for Mars missions is 18 successes, and 25 failures. The InSight mission hopes to improve the odds.

item.title: Episode 0, Trailer
item.description: Eight stories, one mission to outer space. “On a Mission,” a new podcast from NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory, launches October 29.
